speaker: Facebook posts
vclaim: Says Barabara Walters wrote that Jane Fonda "betrayed not only the idea of our country, but specific men who served and sacrificed during the Vietnam War."
date: stated on May 16, 2018 in a Facebook post:
title: There’s still no evidence Barbara Walters wrote this about Jane Fonda
text:
Facebook users are again resharing an old missive that’s critical of actress Jane Fonda and, according to the post, attributed to former ABC News journalist Barbara Walters. 
We debunked a similar post in October. Now, this nearly identical May 2018 post is getting heavy traffic. It’s been shared more than 540,000 times and it was flagged as part of Facebook’s efforts to combat false news and misinformation on its News Feed. (Read more about our partnership with Facebook.) 
The post details allegations against Fonda that other fact-checkers have looked into. But it begins by claiming that Barbara Walters wrote it. 

Featured Fact-check
















Bloggers


stated on January 13, 2021 in a story








Says Gen. David H. Berger, commandant of the U.S. Marine Corps., refused Nancy Pelosi’s request to use the Marines for inauguration security, telling her “we don’t work for you.”












By Samantha Putterman • January 17, 2021







"Barbara Walters writes: Unfortunately, many have forgotten and still countless others have never known how Ms. Fonda betrayed not only the idea of our country but specific men who served and sacrificed during the Vietnam War." 
We still can’t find any evidence that Walters said or wrote the statement that appears in this and other Facebook posts. 
We rate it False.
